pci_workflow_create_type_description: A Workflow describes one or multiple actions.
pci_workflow_create_type_instance_backup: This Workflow will generate Instance backups, the backups could be used to start new Instances.
pci_workflow_create_schedule_rotate_desc: A backup is taken every day between 10PM to 6AM and the rotation maintains a history of {{ numEntries }} entries. When the new backup is complete, the oldest is deleted.
pci_workflow_create_schedule_custom_desc: Choose by yourself the scheduling (UNIX Cron format), the number of rotations and the max executions you want.
pci_workflow_create_price_title: Each backup will be charged approximately
pci_workflow_create_cron_month_helper_1: 1-12, where 1 is January, 2 is February, and so on.
pci_workflow_create_cron_month_helper_2: Uppercase, lowercase and mixed-case three character strings, based on the English name of the month. For example: {{ monthNameExample }}.
pci_workflow_create_cron_dow_helper_1: 0-6, where 0 is Sunday, 1 is Monday, and so on.
pci_workflow_create_cron_dow_helper_2: Uppercase, and lowercase or mixed-case three character strings, based on the English name of the day: {{ weekNameExample }}.
pci_workflow_create_execution_count_desc: Number of execution to process before ending the job. Zero(0) means that the job will never end.
